#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk open-vm-tools
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: open-vm-tools bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The Open Virtual Machine Tools (open-vm-tools) are the open source implementation of VMware Tools. They are a set of guest operating system virtualization components that enhance performance and user experience of virtual machines. This update fixes the following bugs: When installing the open-vm-tools utility, the vm-support script was stored in the /etc/vmware-tools/ directory. This was very inconvenient, as VMware Tools install the same script in the /usr/bin/ directory and other VMware products expect to find vm-support in the default search path. With this update, vm-support has been moved from /etc/vmware-tools/ to /usr/bin/, so that it is present in the default search path. (BZ#1090686) Previously, uninstalling the open-vm-tools utility left the VMware platform assuming that the open-vm-tools packages were still installed on the guest. To fix this bug, the tools.set.version remote procedure call (RPC) has been added to inform the VMware platform when open-vm-tools has been uninstalled. In addition, the user now receives a message that open-vm-tools is not running because it is not installed. (BZ#1090688) Prior to this update, the open-vm-tools dependencies were not identified properly and seven packages were omitted. To fix this bug, the dependencies have been added, and open-vm-tools installation now pulls all the dependencies as expected. (BZ#1090695) Due to broken Application Binary Interface (ABI) compatibility, the open-vm-tools packages did not work with the libprocps.so.3 RPM source. To fix this bug, open-vm-tools has been rebuilt to require the new libprocps.so.4. (BZ#1140149) Users of open-vm-tools are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
